intro: Pleroma hirsutissimum, commonly known as the hairy pleroma, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
